G4542-d-05-09-99-WC.Narrative: WC TRAIN T205-08 WAS TRAVELING AT APPROXIMATELY 7 MPH IN HEAVY FOG INTO CHIPPEWA FALLS.  THE TRAIN WAS PROCEEDING WESTWARD ON MAIN LINE TRACK WITH TRACK WARRANT AUTHORITY WHEN THEY CAME UPON AN UNOCCUPIED STEAM ENGINE THAT WAS FOULING THE MAINLINE.  THE WC CREW JUMPED FROM THE LOCOMOTIVE ON IMPACT AS STEAM FILLED THE WC LOCOMOTVE CAB.  BOTH THE WC ENGINE AND THE UNOCCUPIED STEAM ENGINE SUSTAINED DAMAGE IN THE IMPACT.  IT IS FELT BY THE MANAGEMENT AT WC THAT THE STEAM ENGINE WAS NOT PROPERLY SECURED BY AN EMPLOYEE OR EMPLOYEES OF THE LOCOMOTIVE & TOWER PRESERVATION FUND.  HOWEVER, THIS INCIDENTIS UNDER INVESTIGATION BY THE NATIONAL TRANSPORATION BOARD AND THE LTPF IS AWAITING RESPONSE FROM THEM AS TO WHAT THEY FEEL WAS THE CAUSE OF THEIR ENGINE ROLLING OUT ONTO THE MAIN TRACK.  THE ENGINEER CONTINUED TO HAVE PROBLEMS WITH HIS LOW BACK AND HAS SINCE SOUGHT TREATMENT FROM A CHIROPRACTOR.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

2599RT-d-05-17-99-RT.Accident Cause: Other brake defects, (Provide detailed description in narrative) (LOCOMOTIVE)
2599RT-d-05-17-99-RT.Narrative: AT 4:00 PM, CREW 211 PLACED LOCOMOTIVE RT 100 ON TRACK 180 TO BE DELIVERED TO THE WHEELING AND LAKEERIE RAILWAY.  THE ENGINEER INDICATED THAT HE DUMPED THE TRAINLINE AIR AND TESTED TO INSURE THE BRAKES ON THE LOCOMOTIVE SET UP, BY SHOVING THE LOCOMOTIVE AHEAD APPROXIMATELY ONE FOOT.  THE CONDUCTORON THE CREW INDICATED THAT HE THEN APPLIED THE LOCOMOTIVE HAND BRAKE.  THE CREW BELIEVING THE LOCOMOTIVE WAS SECURE, LEFT IT ON TRACK 180 UNTIL SUCH TIME THAT IT WOULD BE INTERCHANGED WITH THE WHEELING AND LAKE ERIE.  THEY DID NOT PLACE BLOCKS UNDER THE WHEELS.  APPROXIMATELY TWO HOURS LATER,THE TRAINLINE BRAKES BLED OFF, THE HAND BRAKE DID NOT HOLD AND THE LOCOMOTIVE BEGAN TO ROLL DOWN THE INCLINE OF TRACK 180.  AS IT PROCEEDED, IT BROKE THE DERAIL THAT WAS  ENGAGED AT THE LOWER END OF THE TRACK, WENT THROUGH THE WHEELING AND LAKE ERIE MAIN SWITCH, CROSSED OVER THE LIFT BRIDGE, AND CONTINUEDDOWN TRACK 180 UNTIL IT COLLIDED WITH WHEELING LOCOMOTIVE, WE 2691.  THIS WAS THE LEAD LOCOMOTIVE OFA DOUBLE UNIT THAT WAS COUPLED TO TWENTY-FOUR LOADED CARS AT THE TIME OF THE COLLISION.  THE DERAILMANUFACTURER CALLS FOR SIX SPIKES OR LAG SCREWS TO BE DRIVEN FULLY INTO THE TIES, AND THAT THE TIESBE SOUND AND SPACED TWELVE INCHES TO BEAR AGAINST THE  VERTICAL FLANGES OF THE DERAIL GUIDE BOX.  THE SPACING WAS FIFTEEN AND ONE-HALF INCHES WHICH IS WHY THERE WERE ONLY FOUR SPIKES HOLDING THE DERAIL IN PLACE AND THE OTHER TWO HOLES WERE OVER THE SPACING BETWEEN THE TIES.  THE FORCE OF THE LOCOMO

99051001-d-05-10-99-FWWR.Primary Accident Cause: Use of brakes, other (Provide detailed description in narrative)
99051001-d-05-10-99-FWWR.Accident Cause: Use of brakes, other (Provide detailed description in narrative)
99051001-d-05-10-99-FWWR.Narrative: JOB 401 ROLLED 5 LOADED CARS FROM THE MAIN LINE TO THE SIDING AT THE WEST SIDING SWITCH AT COMANCHE(GORE FEED).  BRAKEMAN WAS RIDING THE LEAD CAR (PTLX 14109) AND HAD CONTROL OF THE AIR BRAKE HANDLEAND THE HAND BRAKE.  BRAKEMAN REALIZED THE ONE HAND BRAKE WOULD NOT STOP THE LOADED CARS AND HE THENATTEMPTED TO USE THE AIR BRAKE CONTROL AND THE HANDLE WOULD NOT MOVE.  AT THIS TIME BRAKEMAN ATTEMPTED TO SECURE ANOTHER HANDBRAKE BUT WAS UNABLE TO DO SO BECAUSE OF THE SPEED OF THE CARS.  THE CARSROLLED INTO THE TRACK AND BRAKEMAN JUMPED FROM THE MOVING CARS WHEN IT BECAME APPARENT THAT HE COULDNOT STOP THEM AND A COLLISION WAS UNAVOIDABLE.  THE FIVE LOADED CARS IMPACTED WITH A TRACK MOBILE AND THREE EMPTY CARS.  THE RESULTING COLLISION DESTROYED THE TRACK MOBILE, DAMAGED TWO HOPPER CARS AND CAUSED SLIGHT DAMAGE TO TRACTOR RIG THAT WAS PARKED NEXT TO THE TRACK.  THERE WAS NO TRACK DAMAGEAND ONLY SLIGHT DAMAGE TO THE INDUSTRY BUILDING.  THE HOPPER CAR THAT WAS LOADED HAD ONE HOPPER DAMAGED AND ONE HOPPER CAR  CAN BE MOVED (PTLX 14109) AND THE OTHER HOPPER CAR (VMP 190293) WILL NEED NEW TRUCKS BEFORE IT CAN BE MOVED.NoneNoneNone

9901-d-05-11-99-BKRR.Primary Accident Cause: Wide gage (due to defective or missing crossties)
9901-d-05-11-99-BKRR.Accident Cause: Wide gage (due to defective or missing crossties)
9901-d-05-11-99-BKRR.Narrative: TRAIN BKF WAS OPERATING NORTHBOUND FROM EAGLE BRIDGE, NY WITH 2 LOCOMOTIVES AND 22 LOADS.  AT MP 132.8, 1 MILE SOUTH OF SHUSHAN, NY, THE TRAIN EXPERIENCED A HARD STOP AS A CONSEQUENCE OF THE HIND 4 CARS DERAILING.   THE HIND 3 OVERTURNED.  ALL INVOLVED CARS WRE COVERED HOPPERS CONTAINING POTASH FERTILIZER.  WE BELIEVE THE SEQUENCE OF THE DERAILMENT WAS AS FOLLOWS:  AS THE TRAIN EXITED A LEFT HANDCURVE TO TANGENT TRACK, ONE TRUCK OF RAILCAR IMCX 12189 FAILED TO SMOOTHLY TRANSITION TO TRACK ALIGNMENT, THEREBY CAUSING THE TRACK GAGE TO SPREAD UNDER LOAD.  IMCX 12189 OVERTURNED ONTO ITS SIDE AND,BECAUSE OF THE LOCKING EFFECT OF SHELF COUPLERS, CAUSE THE CAR AHEAD AND THE CAR BEHIND TO FOLLOW.THE SECOND CAR AHEAD OF IMCX 12189 DERAILED AT THE HIND TRUCK BUT REMAINED UPRIGHT.  THE REAR COUPLER SHANK OF THIS CAR, CP 388789, WAS BROKEN BY THE FORCE OF THE OVERTURNING CAR BEHIND IT.  (CONTINUED ON "SHEET A"  ATTACHED TO THIS REPORT).NoneNoneNoneNoneNone
